text.p: Hi-Tech Pharmacal Co Inc said that through an affiliate it has licensed the patent rights to Huperzine and analogues from the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minn.
In a press release, Hi-Tech said it and its affiliate intend to conduct clinical trials in the U.S. and plan to manufacture and distribute Huperzine as a dietary supplement.

Huperzine is a compound belonging to a class known as acetylcholinesterase inhibitors. It has been shown to inhibit the enzyme responsible for the breakdown of acetylcholine, an important neurotransmitter, or brain chemical, that is believed to be critical in learning and memory.
Hi-Tech and its affiliate also have the exclusive rights to distribute Huperzine in the U.S., Canada and Europe.
